FuncDef:
The traffic-analysis tcp one-way command enables intelligent traffic analysis for unidirectional TCP flows.
The undo traffic-analysis tcp one-way command restores the default configuration. The traffic-analysis tcp one-way command enables intelligent traffic analysis for unidirectional TCP flows. The undo traffic-analysis tcp one-way command restores the default configuration. By default, intelligent traffic analysis for unidirectional TCP flows is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE8850-SAN, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P and CE8850-HAM.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a sequence number or acknowledgment number.
The value must be a hexadecimal number and start with 0x. The length ranges from 3 to 10 digits.

Specifies the mask of the sequence number or acknowledgment number. This mask is similar to the subnet mask of IP addresses. F indicates that the bit is matched, and 0 indicates that the bit is not matched. This helps determine the range of sequence numbers or acknowledgment numbers of TCP packets.
The value must be a hexadecimal number and start with 0x. The length ranges from 3 to 10 digits.

Matches TCP packets with a specified sequence number range or acknowledgment number range.
-
